data.text:
P:04

Good afternoon and welcome back to

Bamber Bridge FC for this afternoonâs

Barclays Womenâs Championship clash

against Birmingham.

I would also like to extend my welcome to

Darren Carter and his Birmingham side that

have made the journey up to Lancashire

today.

This afternoonâs game is our first of our three

festive fixtures at home, and we are looking to

make home advantage count. We have picked

up two wins and draw in our last three home

games and we want to continue that fine form

and that starts today against Birmingham.

We picked up a hard-fought 1-1 draw at

home to Southampton two weeks ago as we

extended our unbeaten league run to five

games. The team had to battle in torrential

conditions to earn that point against a very

strong Southampton side and was pleased

with their performance.

However, we know that we must overcome

a tough Birmingham team today if we want

to make it six league games unbeaten.

Birmingham are full of professional quality

having just come down from the WSL so

they have experience in abundance. Theyâve

experienced a roller-coaster start to life in the

Championship but most recently picked up an

impressive 1-0 away to Bristol City so they will

be full of confidence and looking to make it

back-to-back league wins this afternoon.

Thank you for your support today and we

look forward to seeing you at back at Bamber

Bridge FC next weekend.

THE GAFFER

GEMMA DONNELLY

P:12

Faith, how have you found life with

Rovers so far?

To be honest, it has gone better than I ever

thought it would have. I thought it wouldâve

been harder, but this environment allows me

to make mistakes and progress. I feel like

I have improved personally on and off the

pitch.

This is your first season in the

Barclays Womenâs Championship,

how have you found it?

Every game is worth something and every

game is tough. Itâs good because you want

to play against the best players, and you

want to train with them as well to help you

improve.

You have started every league game

this season so far, how does that

feel?

We caught up with summer recruit Faith Nokuthula ahead of todayâs

game as the defender reflects on her start to life as a Rover and learning

from the teamâs environment.

Itâs a shock in a way. Obviously, I work hard

but to get the rewards from it is great and

I wasnât expecting it. I feel valued which is

good and feel like they trust me to get the

job done.

Have you been learning from your

teammates in the back-line?

I always say to them, just talk to me. Even

if itâs just to say âlook leftâ as it keeps me

switched on. Everyoneâs encouraging even

if you make a mistake â itâs a very open

environment to make mistakes and I feel like

that is the reason why Iâve improved.

What have you made to the teamâs

recent run of form?

It is all nothing that we donât deserve. Behind

the scenes we all work so hard for the games

and when things go wrong itâs tough. But we

didnât give up and now weâre well and we

need to keep that going.
